description: The PV2 segment is a continuation of visit-specific information contained on the PV1 segment.

fields.name: Prior Pending Location
fields.description: This field is required for cancel pending transfer (A27 (cancel pending admit)) messages. In all other events it is optional.

fields.name: Point Of Care
fields.description: Conditional on person location type (e.g., nursing unit or department or clinic). After floor, most general patient location designation. User-defined table 0302 - Point of care is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Room
fields.description: Patient room. After nursing unit, most general person location designation. User-defined table 0303 - Room is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Bed
fields.description: Patient bed. After room, most general person location designation. User-defined table 0304 - Bed is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Facility
fields.description: Most general person location designation. (See Section 2.8.20, HD - hierarchic designator).

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: User-defined table 0300 - Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Location Status
fields.description: Location (e.g., Bed) status. User-defined table 0306 - Location status is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Person Location Type
fields.description: Usually includes values such as nursing unit, department, clinic, SNF, physicians office. User-defined table 0305 - Person location type is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Building
fields.description: After facility, most general person location designation. User-defined table 0307 - Building is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Floor
fields.description: After building, most general person location designation. User-defined table 0308 - Floor is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Location Description
fields.description: A free text description of the location.

fields.name: Accommodation Code
fields.description: This field indicates the specific patient accommodations for this visit. User-defined table 0129 - Accommodation code is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table for values for this field.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: Name or description of the item in question. E.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. Its data type is string (ST).

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier. This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier. ASTM E1238-94, Diagnostic, procedure, observation, drug ID, and health outcomes coding systems are identified in the tables in Section 7.1.4, Coding schemes. Others may be added as needed. When an HL7 table is used for a CE data type, the name of coding system component is defined as HL7nnnn where nnnn is the HL7 table number.

fields.name: Alternate Components
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system. If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component. If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally-defined system.

fields.name: Admit Reason
fields.description: This field contains the short description of the reason for patient admission.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: Name or description of the item in question. E.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. Its data type is string (ST).

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier. This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier. ASTM E1238-94, Diagnostic, procedure, observation, drug ID, and health outcomes coding systems are identified in the tables in Section 7.1.4, Coding schemes. Others may be added as needed. When an HL7 table is used for a CE data type, the name of coding system component is defined as HL7nnnn where nnnn is the HL7 table number.

fields.name: Alternate Components
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system. If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component. If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally-defined system.

fields.name: Transfer Reason
fields.description: This field contains the short description of the reason for a patient location change.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: Name or description of the item in question. E.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. Its data type is string (ST).

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier. This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier. ASTM E1238-94, Diagnostic, procedure, observation, drug ID, and health outcomes coding systems are identified in the tables in Section 7.1.4, Coding schemes. Others may be added as needed. When an HL7 table is used for a CE data type, the name of coding system component is defined as HL7nnnn where nnnn is the HL7 table number.

fields.name: Alternate Components
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system. If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component. If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally-defined system.

fields.name: Patient Valuables
fields.description: This field contains the short description of patient valuables checked in during admission.

fields.name: Patient Valuables Location
fields.description: This field indicates the location of the patient's valuables.

fields.name: Visit User Code
fields.description: This field further categorizes a patient's visit with respect to an individual institution's needs (e.g., teaching flag = TE, indicating the patient is a teaching case). User-defined table 0130 - Visit user code is used as the HL7 identifier or the user-defined table of values for this field.

fields.name: Expected Admit Date/Time
fields.description: This field contains the date and time that the patient is expected to be admitted. This field is also used to reflect the date/time of an outpatient/emergency patient registration.

fields.name: Expected Discharge Date/Time
fields.description: This field contains the date and time that the patient is expected to be discharged. This is a non-event related date used by ancillaries to determine more accurately the projected workloads. This field is also used to reflect the anticipated discharge date/time of an outpatient/emergency patient, or an inpatient.

fields.name: Estimated Length of Inpatient Stay
fields.description: This field specifies the estimated days of inpatient stays.

fields.name: Actual Length of Inpatient Stay
fields.description: This field contains the actual days of inpatient stays. The actual length of the inpatient stay may not be calculated from the admission and discharge dates because of possible leaves of absence.

fields.name: Visit Description
fields.description: This field contains a brief user-defined description of the visit.

fields.name: Referral Source Code
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons
fields.description: This field contains the name and the identification numbers of the person or organization that made the referral. This person/organization is not the same as the referring doctor. For example, Joe Smith referred me to the Clinic (or to Dr. Jones at the Clinic).

fields.name: Id Number
fields.description: This string refers to the coded ID according to a user-defined table, defined by the 9th component. If the first component is present, either the source table or the assigning authority must be valued.

fields.name: Suffix
fields.description: Used to specify a name suffix (e.g., Jr. or III).

fields.name: Prefix
fields.description: Used to specify a name prefix (e.g., Dr.).

fields.name: Degree
fields.description: Used to specify an educational degree (e.g., MD). Refer to user-defined table 0360 Degree for suggested values.

fields.name: Source Table
fields.description: User-defined table 0297 - CN ID source is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component. Used to delineate the first component.

fields.name: Assigning Authority
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. It is a HD data type. Assigning authorities are unique across a given HL7 implementation. User-defined table 0363 Assigning authority is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for the first sub-component of the HD component, <namespace ID>.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: User-defined table 0300 - Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Name Type Code
fields.description: A code that represents the type of name. Refer to HL7 table 0200 - Name type for valid values (see Section 2.8.51, XPN - extended person name).

fields.name: Identifier Check Digit
fields.description: The check digit in this data type is not an add-on produced by the message processor. It is the check digit that is part of the identifying number used in the sending application. If the sending application does not include a self-generated check digit in the identifying number, this component should be valued null.

fields.name: Code Identifying The Check Digit Scheme Employed
fields.description: Refer to HL7 table 0061 - Check digit scheme for valid values.

fields.name: Identifier Type Code
fields.description: A code corresponding to the type of identifier. In some cases, this code may be used as a qualifier to the <assigning authority> component. Refer to user-defined table 0203 - Identifier type for suggested values.

fields.name: Assigning Facility
fields.description: The place or location identifier where the identifier was first assigned to the person. This component is not an inherent part of the identifier but rather part of the history of the identifier: as part of this data type, its existence is a convenience for certain intercommunicating systems.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: User-defined table 0300 - Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Name Representation Code
fields.description: Different <name/address types> and representations of the same <name/address> should be described by repeating of this field, with different values of the <name/address type> and/or <name/address representation> component.

fields.name: Previous Service Date
fields.description: This field contains the date of previous service for the same recurring condition. This may be a required field for billing certain illnesses (e.g., accident related) to a third party.

fields.name: Employment Illness Related Indicator
fields.description: This field specifies whether a patient's illness was job-related. Refer to Chapter 2, HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Purge Status Code
fields.description: This field contains the purge status code for the account. It is used by the application program to determine purge processing. Refer to user-defined table 0213 - Purge status for suggested values.

fields.name: Purge Status Date
fields.description: This field contains the date on which the data will be purged from the system.

fields.name: Special Program Code
fields.description: This field designates the specific health insurance program for a visit required for healthcare reimbursement. Examples include Child Health Assistance, Elective Surgery Program, Family Planning, etc. User-defined table 0214 - Special program codes is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this field.

fields.name: Retention Indicator
fields.description: This field allows the user to control the financial and demographic purge processes at the visit. It is used to preserve demographic and financial data on specific, high priority visits. Refer to Chapter 2, HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Expected Number of Insurance Plans
fields.description: This field contains the number of insurance plans that may provide coverage for this visit.

fields.name: Visit Publicity Code
fields.description: This field contains a user-defined code indicating what level of publicity is allowed (e.g., No Publicity, Family Only) for a specific visit. User-defined table 0215 - Publicitycode is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this field. Refer to PD1-11- publicity code for the patient level publicity code.

fields.name: Visit Protection Indicator
fields.description: This field identifies the person's protection that determines, in turn, whether access to information about this person should be kept from users who do not have adequate authority for a specific visit. Refer to Chapter 2, HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values. Refer to PD1-12- protection indicator for the patient level protection indicator.

fields.name: Clinic Organization Name
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite Name And Identification Number For Organizations
fields.description: This field contains the organization name or sub-unit and identifier that is associated with the (visit) episode of care. For example, the Allergy or Oncology Clinic within the facility might be named.

fields.name: Organization Name
fields.description: The name of the specified organization.

fields.name: Organization Name Type Code
fields.description: A code that represents the type of name i.e., legal name, display name. Refer to user-defined table 0204 - Organizational name type for suggested values.

fields.name: Check Digit
fields.description: The check digit in this data type is not an add-on produced by the message processor. It is the check digit that is part of the identifying number used in the sending application. If the sending application does not include a self-generated check digit in the identifying number, this component should be valued null.

fields.name: Code Identifying The Check Digit Scheme Employed
fields.description: The check digit scheme codes are defined in HL7 table 0061 - Check digit scheme .

fields.name: Assigning Authority
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. It is a HD data type. Assigning authorities are unique across a given HL7 implementation. User-defined table 0363 Assigning authority is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for the first sub-component of the HD component <namespace ID>.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: User-defined table 0300 - Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Identifier Type Code
fields.description: A code corresponding to the type of identifier. In some cases, this code may be used as a qualifier to the Assigning authority component. Refer to user-defined table 0203 - Identifier type for suggested values.

fields.name: Assigning Facility Id
fields.description: The place or location identifier where the identifier was first assigned to the person. This component is not an inherent part of the identifier but rather part of the history of the identifier: as part of this data type, its existence is a convenience for certain intercommunicating systems.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: User-defined table 0300 - Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Name Representation Code
fields.description: Different <name/address types> and representations of the same <name/address> should be described by repeating of this field, with different values of the <name/address type> and/or <name/address representation> component.

fields.name: Patient Status Code
fields.description: This field indicates the status of the episode of care: for instance, Active Inpatient vs. Discharged Inpatient. Refer to user defined table0216 - Patient status for suggested values.

fields.name: Visit Priority Code
fields.description: This field contains the priority of the visit, e.g., whether the admission is an emergency, elective, or urgent. Refer to user defined table 0217 - Visit priority for suggested values.

fields.name: Previous Treatment Date
fields.description: This field contains the date that the patient last had treatment for any condition prior to this visit. In the case of a prior hospital visit, it is likely to be the previous discharge date.

fields.name: Expected Discharge Disposition
fields.description: This field describes what the patient's disposition is expected to be at the end of the visit. Refer to user-defined table 0112 - Discharged disposition for suggested values.

fields.name: Signature on File Date
fields.description: This field contains the date on which a signature was obtained for insurance billing purposes.

fields.name: First Similar Illness Date
fields.description: This field is used to determine if the patient has a pre-existing condition.

fields.name: Patient Charge Adjustment Code
fields.description: This field contains a user-defined code that indicates which adjustments should be made to this patient's charges. User-defined table 0218 - Charge adjustment is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this field. This field is the same as GT1-26-guarantor charge adjustment code .

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: Name or description of the item in question. E.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. Its data type is string (ST).

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier. This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier. ASTM E1238-94, Diagnostic, procedure, observation, drug ID, and health outcomes coding systems are identified in the tables in Section 7.1.4, Coding schemes. Others may be added as needed. When an HL7 table is used for a CE data type, the name of coding system component is defined as HL7nnnn where nnnn is the HL7 table number.

fields.name: Alternate Components
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system. If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component. If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally-defined system.

fields.name: Recurring Service Code
fields.description: This field indicates whether the treatment is continuous. User-defined table 0219 - Recurring service is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this field.

fields.name: Billing Media Code
fields.description: This field indicates if the account is to be rejected from tape billing. Refer to Chapter 2 , HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Expected Surgery Date & Time
fields.description: This field contains the date and time on which the surgery is expected to occur.

fields.name: Military Partnership Code
fields.description: This field indicates that a military facility has contracted with a non-military facility for the use of its services. Refer to Chapter 2, HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Military Non-Availability Code
fields.description: This field indicates whether a patient has permission to use a non-military facility for treatment. Refer to Chapter 2 , HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Newborn Baby Indicator
fields.description: This field indicates whether the patient is a baby. Refer to Chapter 2, HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Baby Detained Indicator
fields.description: This field indicates if the baby is detained after the mother's discharge. Refer to Chapter 2, HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.
